title: Analysis of Cognitive-Social Participation Types and Strategy Design in Online Science Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science knowledge and experience using online collaboration tools
context.additional_context: Students perform collaborative science activities on asynchronous discussion platforms using digital devices, analyzing learning participation patterns through formative assessments and developing improvement strategies

learning_goals: Students can accurately distinguish participation types (lurk, superficial, task, respond, expand, create) on online discussion platforms.
Students can improve cognitive-social engagement levels by at least one stage during science problem-solving processes through collaborative activities.
Students can propose participation strategies tailored to profile-specific characteristics ('bench sitter', 'hustler', 'striker', 'champion') in team-based feedback sessions.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
